name: Hotel Amadeus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We experienced two different rooms at Amadeus and Musica, both 2nd floor. The rooms were quiet, as initially requested at the time of booking, except one night when some residents came back around 2-3 a.m. and chatted loud for nearly one hour in the lounge area of the ground floor of Musica. Anyone who plans to stay at either of the two hotels, is advised to mind as conversation in such structure would echo through the building, more than you may think.
reviews.title: Great location. Quality services.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We prefer our Amadeus Verdi room (with piano) to our Musica room.
reviews.title: Charming and quaint!!

reviews.text: The Musica room was cold: air-conditioning was not well functioning. The bathroom is getting tired and you are obliged to stare at moss sitting in the bathtub. The bathroom was also cold.The windows are small making the room rather dark. The hotel arranged to bring some blankets and also an electric heater, which made the following night warm and comfortable. We appreciate their prompt and effective services.
reviews.title: A Truely Unique Hotel

reviews.text: The Amadeus room with piano was charming. The room is small and right on the inside balcony, but the entrance door is double, making it quiet and private enough. Whilst the bathroom is reasonably cleaned, I would wish to see the bathroom updated next time I stay here. The room was warm and comfortable without turning on the air-conditioning.
reviews.title: Great location, room, cleanliness--LOVED IT!

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good. I liked their coffee and bread. Oranges, cheese.
reviews.title: Hotel Amadeus Scores High!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 3 nights in mid Sept. Stayed in their new building in a large room on 1st floor (US 2nd floor) with 3 windows/balconies on the street.Furnished in country antiques with large modern bath it was very comfortable and not at all noisy. Rather plain Continental breakfast served in room, on rooftop terraces or sitting area downstairs. Both buildings have free computers for your use. Main hotel has coffee 24 hours. Owner and her assistants most helpful. Recommendations for dining were right on. We had some laundry done. Dropped off in morning and back by noon. Unheard of! Also not expensive. The music theme and decor is not intrusive and adds to the character of the hotel of which there is much. A delightful place to stay in a perfect Santa Cruz location a short walk to everything and surrounded by old squares and streets.
reviews.title: unique and very nice

reviews.text: When I discovered this hotel, I hesitated to expect from it all that it was promising, but I found it to be excellent in every way. We stayed in La Musica, in a room facing the street. It is an old mansion, with real (not "hotel") furniture, tile floors, small rooms and tiny hallways, patios, and is run by the family that owns it. There are even family photos around the hotel. I particularly enjoyed the fresh flowers in our room, the piano room, and the doors/windows that opened onto the street. We didn't need much from the staff, so I can't comment much on that. Book early, as there are very few rooms. We weren't able to stay as many nights as we would have liked. It's in Santa Cruz, which makes it all the more charming.
reviews.title: Perfect for what we wanted

reviews.text: June 2007
reviews.title: wonderful amadeus

reviews.text: This boutique hotel is cultured, charming, in the best spot to see Seville, in a totally quiet street. We stayed 17 of us, great-grandmother, grandparents, children and grandchildren ranging in ages from 2 to 94, coming from the USA, and we felt like being in a family. Everything worked perfectly. The decorations are superb, the classical music a delight, the teenagers used the computer in the upstairs hall, and one, a gifted pianist, was able to give two concerts, one in the grand piano and one in the studio piano in the music room. Every room has the name of a composer and is different, with its own charm. My husband and I had one overlooking a classic Andalusian patio with flowers.
reviews.title: We just loved the Amadeus Hotel

likes.liked: — The atmosphere, and the fact that we were made to feet like guests in a home, rather than a hotel
likes.disliked: — One of our rooms (102-Mahler) was really tiny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts on the roof terrace overlooking Seville were enchanting, the only improvement we would want is a couple of more beach umbrellas. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and pleasant. It was an experience to remember, and the price was extremely reasonable. We cannot recomment this marvelous boutique hotel enough.
reviews.title: Good town centre location

likes.liked: — Bed Linen was deluxe and the location was perfect.
likes.disliked: — Room 3 was so small which was disappointing as I had booked and confirmed my reservation 5 months in advance

reviews.text: My friend and I spent the nights of April 4 & 5 here, and for 96 euros per night. The minute we stepped in there, we felt like we'd stepped back two centuries. The living room is decked out with a cello or a bass, a harp, and furnishings that Mozart would have been comfortable in (duh, the hotel is named after him). A decanter of local sherry sits out waiting to welcome guests. There are musical-themed knicknacks everywhere and the room keys are shaped like instruments (our room was Strauss and we had a tuba). This looks like a home that had been lovingly decorated over years and years (which makes sense because that what it was!!)
reviews.title: Unique, enchanting jewel perfectly located in the Barrio Santa Cruz

reviews.text: Our room was absolutley adorable - two twin beds with sunny yellow bedcover, old antique furniture, and a bathroom that looked quaint but delivered steaming hut showers with great water pressure. Whoever is running this operation is extremely detail-oriented. - everything looks antique but you get modern amenities. Plus bathrobes, which are extremely rare at this pricepoint. They also have a service that does your laundry for 15 euros so you can go home with clean clothes.
reviews.title: great location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's internet on the second floor and they have a breakfast option for 7 euros that you can take in your room, in any of the sitting rooms scattered about, or upstairs on the terrace. The staff is uniformly excellent - we saw at least five different people and they were all as gracious and charming as the hotel itself. It is clear that this excellently-run place is not resting on its laurels - they really wok at polishing this jewel so it shines for everyone.
reviews.title: A small, comfortable hotel with a friendly service

reviews.text: I could have just spent a whole day exploring the house, but the sun was shining and I didn't have too much time in Sevilla so off we went. Had it been raining, though, I wouldn't have felt cheated since lounging around in this hotel would have been a wonderful travel experience in itself. If you know Sevilla, you'll know that the Barrio Santa Cruz is an excellent place to see patios - I'd wander elsewhere for food to escape some of the touristy places, but there's tons of bars and restaurants around if you are no so inclined.
reviews.title: Pick Another Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only con was the directions by bus from Santa Justa Station that they have on the internet. They make no sense whatsoever, and I am a seasoned traveller! For anyone else who intends to take the bus from Sevilla Santa Justa, ignore the directions they give and just take the C1 from the station to the Prado San Sebastian bus station and follow your map from there. MUCH easier. You could not pay me enough to drive in this area and I wish it was a pedestrian only zone because the cars are merciless!
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location
A gem
reviews.text: This hotel was wonderful. The decor was charming, the staff were warm and friendly, the location was perfect and to top this all off, the price was fantastic.
I stayed in the newer La Musica de Sevilla, but would like a chance to stay in Amadeus when I return- which appeared to be a little more boutique than La Musica.
reviews.title: Up in the Attic
What a nice hotel!
reviews.text: The only fault I can find is that the hotel ran out of croissants at breakfast (maybe I should have woke up a little earlier)!
See you soon Amadeus.
reviews.title: This hotel was perfect!!!

reviews.text: My wife, mother, stepfather and I spend 4 nights at the Amadeus. The staff was very helpful when my step-father left his wallet in a cab. We had taken the cab from the hotel so they knew how to contact the company. We explained what had happened and they called the company. To everyone's surprise the cabbie was identified, queried and found the wallet untouched. He promptly returned it.
reviews.title: More raves for Hotel Amadeus!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Amadeus Sevilla for five days in March of 2006. It is a charming European hotel, beautifully appointed and superbly managed. We had the room called "Beethoven"; one of the smaller rooms in the hotel, but certainly big enough for two. The room was quiet, immaculately cleaned, nicely decorated and came with beautiful fresh flowers in an alcove next to the bed. The design of the interior of the hotel is, of course, based on a musical theme, with a grand piano, a harp and various other musical instruments in the main public areas. There is also an excellent collection of books and music available. Suffice to say, the hotel is beautiful. But beyond the beauty it is the service that makes the Amadeus a fine place to stay in Sevilla. The staff is attentive and extremely helpful. We were under the weather for one day and the staff kept us supplied with hot tea and light food and generally watched out for us. When we were recovered and wanted to do some sightseeing outside Sevilla the staff fixed us up with an outstanding driver who showed us around the area north of Sevilla at a very reasonable price. Also, when we were under the weather and could not attend the Flamenco Concert, for which we had reserved tickets, the staff had our tickets exchanged for the following night and we were able to see the concert. We were pleased with such thoughtful service. The service, the ambiance and the convenient location make the Hotel Amadeus a great place to stay in Sevilla.
reviews.title: Great Service, Ambiance and Location
Wonderful, relaxing stay! Great location also!
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic if you want to be in a great location for a great price. I am a student studying here in Seville for the semester and I booked a several night stay there not knowing what to expect for my parents. Keep in mind that I have seen other hotels in Seville and so I have a fairly good basis for comparison. My parents LOVED IT. It has a very European feel and is very comfortable. The decour is very nice and the rooms each have their own different apsect, so we were told. This means that all rooms vary in sizes and character, and if you are one who prefers a more spacious stay, just tell them. The service was great and our room was very clean each night. The hotel incorporated a nice blend of classic Europe with modern technology, including a flat screen TV as well as a state-of-the-art Hydromassage shower head, which was felt great on a travel-weary body.

Now about location. The hotel is situated in the center of Seville. This means that you are about a 4 minute walk from the Cathedral of Seville and within a stone´s throw of great Tapas bars and restaurants that are among the best of the city.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.text: All in all, I am very confident that you will more than enjoy your stay in Hotel Amadeus. The staff, the price, the accomodations, and location are all fantastic.
reviews.title: Be careful of the room you choose

reviews.text: We four fifty-somethings have just returned from a four night stay at Amadeus.and cannot fault hotel in any way. Our rooms on the first floor were just standard rooms, but beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean - towls were automatically changed every day, bedlinen twice during stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast up on the roof terrace with a wonderful view of the Giralda started the day off perfectly.
reviews.title: A great value

reviews.text: Immediately you step inside this unique hotel you can't help but unwind to the soft classical music playing in the background. The Amadeus is very clean with really friendly staff and within walking distance of all the attractions of Seville. Restaurants and tapas bars are abundant. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Cathedral is a must. For excellent tapas with a difference (sort of a la carte) try the Vineria San Telmo on Paseo Catalina de Ribera next to the De Los Jardines de Murillo. Ramon and Juan gave us excellent service. Seville is a great city without the masses.
reviews.title: Unique, charming and cosy

reviews.text: One of the most charming places we've ever stayed. The owners really keep the place in tip-top shape... very clean. We stayed on the top floor of the Musica de Sevilla in the Flamenco Room and it was just perfect. I know it costs more than Hotel Amadeus, but I'm not sure what the difference in rooms is. I can tell you that we had a brand new bathroom that was modern and sparkling clean... Great shower. We also had our own private terrace which was great. Just above us was a terrace balcony for other guests. If you stay here, make sure you go to the top floor to check this out. The location in the old town is also great... walking distance to all the sites and many restaurants.
reviews.title: Stayed at Musica de Sevilla & Loved It

reviews.text: One warning for US visitors though... I overheard a guest questioning the conversion rate of his bill at check-out and assumed it was because he was paying in cash. However, when I checked out and payed by credit card the hotel converted my bill to US dollars at a conversion rate above the standard rate and charged me in US dollars. I didn't notice until after I was gone and it was only a difference of $20, but I think this is an unfair business practice. We stayed at 8 hotels during our trip and payed all by credit card. Hotel Amadeus was the only one that didn't have my credit card do the conversion.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: We stayed in the annex of the Hotel Amadeus, "la musica de sevilla'". It has the same atmosphere, but it is more modern. We askes for a quiet room and we got one indeed. We stayed in the "sonata" room on the first floor. The room was spacious, very clean, quite modern but a little bit dark (wich is frequent in Andaluçia, because of the sun). The airco worked fine and we had a large bathroom with a hydromassage shower, a bath and 2 sinks. We had a microwave and a fridge in the room.
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.text: People at reception are very friendly and there's free internet access.
reviews.title: Smelly Lavatory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Peaceful location on a passageway between 2 streets (they never know which end the cabs will pull up at), and the musical theme adds a certain charm. Helpful staff - made arrangements for a flamenco show on very short notice. We didn't order the breakfast, as we don't eat enough at that hour to have made the 8 Euros worth it. We had the "Verdi" room - bedroom was tight (I was afraid I would whack my hand or head in the middle of the night on the end of the piano, which has to be right up against the edge of the bed, and finding a way to place the lamp so I could read while sitting in the armchair was problematic), but bathroom plenty roomy. About 5 min. walk to Cathedral - close enough to be convenient, but far enough to be beyond the noisiest nightlife area. All in all, a pleasant place to stay for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Pleasant and reasonably priced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is very nice, all decorated with music stuff. I had a room in the hotel de la musica, wich is just near the amadeus hotel, in the second flor, the room was really great, We, (I was there with my partner) had a toilet inside with a really nice bath. The room was very clean, and the best, really the best was the bed. The best bed I sleep ever, so good... and we could go afterward to have our breakfast in the top in a great balcony where I could even see the Giralda.
reviews.title: Very nice place, very calm and the recepcionist is very kind.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed a lot the personal, the woman who brings the breakfast its very funny and actually everyone in the hotel was very warm and relax.
reviews.title: Wonderful atmosphere and location

reviews.text: Apart of that they gives us good information about where to eat, and turistic information with a map for free.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Sevilla, hands down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really recomended this hotel to anyone that want to feel coisy and enjoy a musical atmosphere.
reviews.title: Beware, charm masks many faults
Extremely charming and comfortable!
reviews.text: Amadeus in Seville is music for old romantics, a splendid location in the best part of Santa Cruz area and with an out-of-this-world staff. I sure be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Amadeus was recommended by several books/websites. Despite the fact you could only book a room via email (i was worried about that) we booked anyways. Of the 6 different hotels we stayed in during our trip to Spain, this was by far our favorite. It had great decor (moorish in the main areas, but comfortable and cozy rooms) and the staff was incredibly friendly. Hotel Amadeus has the best of everything; location, comfort, ambiance, friendliness, price. I will recommend this place to anyone I know travelling to Seville!
reviews.title: The Feeling of Home

likes.liked: — it felt like home, very comfortable.

reviews.text: I get the feeling hotels in Seville aren't that great. This was an average hotel as far as we were concerned. We had a hard time finding it specifically b/c of the directions from the hotel so I guess that started us out on the wrong footing. We had the Flamenco room and I'd recommend it, the new addition is kind of cold but I think the rooms are nicer. Nothing to really complain about but nothing to shout about either.
reviews.title: Just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no doubt that the hotel Amadeus offers charm and style in abundance and the location is great for central tourist Seville. The roof terrace is excellent although we didn't take breakfast at the hotel.
reviews.title: Charming hotel but noisy room

likes.liked: — Central location, cosy and charming feel
likes.disliked: — Very noisy room, no hot water in the shower on our last day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we were put in room 1 on the ground floor which came with its own surround-sound and was no fun. The room had noise coming at it from three sides - outside on the street; inside the reception area; outside as other guests entered and left the building through the very heavy, clanking, metal door. Also, on our last morning there (we stayed 3 nights September 2007) there was no hot water in the shower. It's a real shame about the noise and the shower, it's completley put us off staying at the Hotel Amadeus again although as I said in my first sentence above, the hotel is charming and in a great location - as long as you don't get stuck in the very noisy room 1.
reviews.title: felt like home

reviews.text: This was one of the only hotels in Iberia where the wireless actually worked as advertised, so it gets 5 stars on that basis alone. We were on the ground floor, and were afraid of lobby/street noise, but it really wasnt a problem. The location is great - close to the cathedral, Archives of the Indias, the tram, etc. I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast on the rooftop patio, especially since "breakfast" is open until 2pm. Really nice and helpful staff, too.
reviews.title: Great location, and the wireless actually works!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is long overdue.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in a Beautiful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at La Musica de Sevilla in September of 2007 (Hotel Amadeus was sold out at the time). We arrived by car (avoid this means if at all possible) After driving around for what seemed like hours trying to find a garage or parking space, I finally managed to land a parking spot two blocks away. While being wound up from navigating the narrow cobblestone streets in my 5 speed rental, my mood was quickly brightened upon stepping into the lobby of the Amadeus for check in. This is truly a unique property with loads of musically themed character. Check in staff were very helpful, and assisted us with locating the private garage space (you'll need to reserve this well in advance). We walked down the alley from Amadeus and entered the foyer of La Musica. The foyer is tastefully decorated, has a piano and free internet access available for your use.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

likes.liked: — The decor was southern-Spain-sumptuous at its best

reviews.title: Gracious hosts, lovely hotel
reviews.text: We took the modern elevator up to our our room. Our room was large and clean, with big bay windows that open up onto the street below and the Church across the way. No complaints other than the room safe needs to be secured better. My favorite feature was the roof- top deck. We enjoyed the sunset and Sevilla views from the roof, seated at one of the patio tables with a bottle of wine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please take the time to stop by a tapas bar (la Bodega was great) for a quick bite. These are not to be missed!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Amadeus was ideally located on a quiet alleyway a few blocks from the major sites as well as the bus station. The entire hotel is uniquely decorated with musical instruments adding character to the lobby areas as well as the guest rooms. Our room was extremely comfortable: great bed, high quality linens, spacious bathroom, and the common areas, including the rooftop terrace, felt more like a home than a hotel. The hotel is family run, and the entire staff was extremely helpful, providing recommendations for activities (i.e. flamenco, etc) and even making reservations on our behalf. I enthusiastically recommend Hotel Amadeus!
reviews.title: Hotel Amadeus was Wonderful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: December 19, 2008
reviews.title: Hotel Amadeus is Quintessentially Seville

likes.disliked: — Electric lighting in the room could have been brighter

reviews.title: Wonderfull filling mosaics
reviews.text: We stayed at the Amadeus for six nights in late October and returned for one night in early November before flying back to the States. This small, niche hotel was perfectly located for one to walk almost everywhere in beautiful Seville. The pleasant, accommodating staff and comfortable superior double room made our stay most enjoyable. Our room, located on the first floor, was clean and quiet. Others have remarked that the rooms on the ground floor, given that they open onto the main lobby area, are at times noisy, and we can see how that might be a problem. So request at booking a room on the first floor or above. If you are is looking for modern, upscale accommodations with a plethora of amenities, our advice is to seek out a Marriott or its cousins. It you wish to experience something of the ethos of Seville, this is definitely a hotel we would wholeheartedly recommend.

Very nice architecture, comfortable, clean and nice rooms, the service was excellent, its location is fabulous, quite and near to everywhere... I'm sure next time I'll go to Seville I'll be in Hotel Amadeus ....Muchas gracias por la atención, sigan así
reviews.title: Cozy, Lovely, Quiet

likes.disliked: — the smell of burnt toast one morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after my husband had a conference in another part of Seville and loved it. The rooms were quiet, peaceful, clean and well-appointed. The bathroom was a little on the small side without a tub (Beethoven Room) which was slightly unexpected. The staff is very helpful and multi-lingual. Location is great. Taxi drivers had difficulty finding the place. I would stay here again - it's romantic, quaint and everything you would imagine for a Seville hotel. It's one of the few hotels that looked just like the pictures on the web site. Wireless is available but worked best in the lobby.
reviews.title: Memorable experience
above average
reviews.text: I like your review we just got back from Seville and spent two nights at the Amadeus which was plenty- the place was clean and nice but the walls were paper thin so sleep was tough we also ran into the one armed lady-she is a bit cranky!! I guess it was not just me-I will say everyone else there more than made up for it they were great. The hotel is tucked away which in some ways is great in others it could be a problem-remember leave a trail of crumbs when you leave because you could wind around for some time getting home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Amadeus for two nights and we loved. The hotel has an incredible atmosphere. There were many musical instruments and I could play piano in an acoustic room. The bedrooms were thematic and named with classic compositors. The bedroom which we stayed was little but very comfortable. The area of the shower was very small but ok. The breakfast was amazing. We just ordered and they served us on the terrace with a great view from Giralda. The hotel has a good location, near the historical center of Seville.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights during the first week of Oct. The hotel is beautifully decorated and in a great location. The view is wonderful from the balcony. Our room was adequate, but very hot. I was never able to cool off, even with the air conditioner set as low as it could go. My partner finally went down to talk to the woman at the front desk. She was sarcastic, questioning our ability to use the AC remote correctly. (This could have been because she was irritable because her arm was in a sling.)
reviews.title: Adequate, but wouldn't stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price was reasonable. Be aware, what you really pay for here is the ambiance of the common areas; nothing more and nothing less.
reviews.title: Wonderful and unique hotel at a great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 103 - the Wagner room (double room; 100 Euro / night + tax).
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We stayed here based on the majority of the reviews on this site, and we were quite satisfied. We specifically asked not to have a ground-level room. Our room was the "Chopin", and when we checked in, after an exhausting journey from Madrid, we were delighted to be able to relax to a CD featuring Chopin's music while lounging on a very comfortable bed. The room was very small, but fine for a short stay where one isn't planning to unpack a lot of clothing. The view from our window was nice. The bathroom was more than adequate by European standards. The breakfast wasn't elaborate, but being served on the rooftop overlooking one of Europe's most charming cities was quite wonderful. The location of the hotel is great, on a street that is so narrow that it can only be accessed by pedestrians. (Don't worry, because the door is just a few doors from the corner where the taxi lets you off.) You can easily walk to most of the sights, and to many excellent restaurants. One of the owners provided us with some wonderful dining recommendations. All in all, highly recommended!
reviews.title: We recommend Hotel Amadeus!

reviews.text: It is definitely the luck of the draw when it comes to the rooms. The Amadeus is perfectly adequate and is cheap, but we wouldn't stay there again. Our room on the ground floor was tiny, so small we didn't even unpack and the bathroom was constantly damp. The safe didn't work nor did the coffee/chocolate machine.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed

reviews.text: To be fair to the hotel the other rooms seemed to be nicer, it was very clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Its location is great and the view from the roof terrace lovely.
reviews.title: An enjoyable visit.

reviews.text: We visited for 3 nights in mid-April and would agree with nearly all of the previous comments - so mine will be brief.
reviews.title: Mozart Room 201

reviews.text: We also stayed in room and 301 and enjoyed the semi-private covered balcony right outside our door. Other guests passing by or noise were not a problem. We did not need the room AC, but I would be concerned about this room in the middle of the summer and the ability of the AC to handle it.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring Seville

description: The only hotel in Spain with a classical music theme. The hotel is built around a typical Sevillian patio of the eighteenth century (1745), situated between the Barrio de Santa Cruz and the Juderia, very close to the Giralda. It was recently refurbished but retains all its original charm. There are 19 rooms available, fully equipped with telephone, satellite television, air conditioning, minibar, en suite bathroom and security safe.
